events.text: Get what you need and leave.
What’s with the hooded guy out there?
That bastard?
Hey, Hey!
The same waste of life responsible for what’s happened to this town?
They deserve it!
Those wearing black cloaks are altered researchers responsible for the exposure in this town and are hiding their disgusting forms.
They’re responsible?
How’s that?
Ask the old man in the residential area.
He takes care of the only kid in town.
He’ll tell you more on why we don’t help them.
But that’s the rule.
Whether it be out of fear of being exposed to their seeping radiation or being exiled from what little town remains into the frosting like the other researchers.
It’s something everyone has come to understand.
The altered try and come into town to get food, but they know if they enter my shop, I’ve got buck shot waiting for them behind this counter.
They don’t deserve help after what they allowed to happen.
I see...
You’re all just worried about yourselves…
You’d let another human being suffer for something they had no control over?!
What the hell do you know?!
Tch!
Leo, let’s just hear him out…
That beggar out there is probably one of the altered staying at the abandoned research facility up the road.
There are rumors of an altered female who is still mostly human that defends those bastards from outsiders.
While you're making your visit short, I’d stay away from there if you like having your sight and not choking on your own blood.
She’s probably doing it for good reason too...
Buy what you need and get the hell out of my shop...
Prices have increase by $5
Can you tell me a little about Chester’s Peak?
All you need to know is that a militia group claiming to be part of the United States military set up a ‘protective detail’ near the nuclear plant.
In order to ‘protect’ the townspeople and offer aid.
From terrorist or a nuclear meltdown if the plant is restarted.
Believe half of what you see and none of what you hear…
Although they shared some of their generators and food at first, once their commander showed up, they began to sell their aid to us.
If we didn’t have the money, they’d force us to pay with other ‘goods and services’...
Those bastards...
The smallest inkling of one person not cooperating?
It’s why we don’t want you here.
Outsiders only cause problems for our families.
What about the Militia Group you mentioned?
Their commander’s name is Alvin Stockfielt.
He’s the one ordering the soldiers to take advantage of us.
But it’s not like they don’t enjoy it either...
Get rid of that bastard and his spineless goons will easily give up.
Knowing that we should be able to prevent a lot of unnecessary fighting.
Alistair won’t like it, but he should hear about this.
You didn’t hear that from me though…
